definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Your ankle is badly swollen; I think the doctor ought to look at it.
sentences.chinese: 你的腳腕子腫得很厲害，我看得請醫生看看。

sentences.english: He winced as the dog nipped his ankle.
sentences.chinese: 狗咬了他的腳腕子，疼得他齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: The dog was nipping at her ankles.
sentences.chinese: 那狗咬着她的腳腕子了。

sentences.english: He swayed slightly, as if about to fall.
sentences.chinese: 她準是跌倒時把腳腕子給產歪了。

sentences.english: He hitched his pack farther over on his left shoulder, so as to take a portion of its weight from off the injured ankle.
sentences.chinese: 他把揹包向左肩挪了挪，以減輕扭傷的腳腕子的負擔。

sentences.english: I say, Bill, I've sprained my ankle .
sentences.chinese: 喂，比爾，我扭傷腳腕子啦。
